availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry C. Dunlap (Lexington, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, lawyer and soldier. Married Martha E. Bryce Dunlap on October 29, 1848. Married to LaBelle Dunlap. Father of J. R. Dunlap and Ethelbert D. Dunlap. Lawyer in Lafayette County, Missouri in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Lafayette County in 1850. Lawyer in Lexington in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860. Served in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as adjutant to May 26, 1862. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and colonel from May 26, 1862 to October 13, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Missouri, Lafayette County, District 46, p. 145B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Missouri, Lafayette County, District 46, p. 49.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 95.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 4, p. 53.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 172.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 592.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 919.
